data.title: Nothing's Happening

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.0.0 - OS Version: OS X Yosemite 10.10.5 So... nothing's happening. I downloaded the VSCode package and the icon showed up on my desktop. I double clicked and I guess it unarchived...? I moved the Visual Studio Code.app to my Applications folder. Basically, I did everything as I was supposed to. Whenever I try to open it though, the menu bar flickers to 'Code' but then it's back to Finder. Saw this on the console. What's wrong? And what do I do? Heeelp.

data.title: Allow adding non-workspace files from working files
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a folder
2. Open a file outside that folder
3. Drag the non-workspace file from working files to your open folder in explorer

You cannot move the non-workspace file into your project from working files. I'm guessing this might be by design based on #4893

data.title: Window snap does not reopen Code at the same size

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10 (1440p resolution)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Drag the Code window to snap left or right
2. Close and reopen Code

When snapped left, it reopens slightly smaller with extra space to the bottom and left and moves slightly right. When snapped right, it reopens slightly smaller with space left at the bottom and right sides.

data.title: Screen reader not reading some full keybindings

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

Prereq: Install NVDA

There are a few keybindings not being read:
1. Right click in a file and hover over "Change All Occurances" reads as "Ctrl +" and does not read F2
2. In the Goto menu "Go to Definition" does not read F12.
3. In the File menu "Close Editor" reads "Ctrl +" and does not read F4
4. In the View menu "Zoom out" reads "Ctrl +" and does not read "-"
5. In the View menu "Split Editor" reads "Ctrl +" and does not read "\"

data.title: JavaScript IntelliSense missing on recreated file
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.1.0-alpha, 1.0-stable
- OS Version:Windows 10, OS X, Ubuntu 14.04

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create an empty folder and create a new file, app.js
2. Type console. - you get IntelliSense for Console methods.
3. Delete app.js and recreate it.
4. Type console. - no IntelliSense

Need to restart VS Code for IntelliSense to be active again for app.js.
Another workaround is to change the language (ex. C) then change back to JavaScript manually.

data.title: Extension search should allow quote operator
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. F1 > ext install "Java"

This displays the "No extensions found" message. If you search for java by itself, most of the results are for JavaScript.

data.title: VS Code does not start sometimes
data.body:
Often I'll have Code open and then try to open a new file either through code.bat, "Open With Code", or even from the Start Menu and nothing will happen. I assume this has been reported several times before, but couldn't find anything as there are lots of issues reported here.
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: 10.14335

Steps to Reproduce:
Not 100% sure of the steps to get this to happen every time
1. Have code running already with some files open (1 or more instances of it)
2. Right click on a file and select `Open with Code`
3. Nothing starts up - no additional `code.exe`s show up in Task Manager

![Task Manager when code is not working - only 1 window](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1149244/15053789/126e454a-12b9-11e6-9382-92cf2350672c.png)

If I then close all of the active Code windows and try again, things work.
This means that I then lose my active files :(

data.title: Improve Open in Terminal in Mac
data.body:
This also fixes #391 

Tested in `Mac OS X 10.11.4 (15E65)`
With `Terminal Version 2.6.1 (361.1)` and `iTerm2 Build 2.1.4`

`DEFAULT_TERMINAL_MAC` also can be set as `terminal.app` or even `terminal` but I can't test if that works with older version of `open` command in previous Mac OS

data.title: Allow choosing which local to use in the application.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Windows 8.1

Please allow choosing which local to use in the application. It's stupid that it is sometimes difficult to follow tutorials on the net that depends on english when the interface is not in English, furthermore, several translations make no sense. I'm ready to contribute though, if you are interested.

data.title: Quick File Navigation as you type

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: It would be great when I want to perform a Quick Open on a file that VSCode would search as I type. Atom and Sublime do this and it makes finding files so much easier.

data.title: C# not coloring syntax
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.0.0
- OS Version: windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

I've had Visual studio code installed since open beta. got several updates as time went along
1. Opened a csharp file and there was an update since i hadn't used VSCode in a few weeks. updated because the update notes said something C# now supported.
2. text appears plain as if a txt file.
3. installed C# extension through ext install then selected the first C# that popped up (C# for visual studio code (powered by omnisharp) )
4. text still white

data.title: Getting an error unable to cast COM object of type
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.0.0
- OS Version:Windows 7 Enterprise
  
  Visual C++ 2015 14.0.23026 is installed in the machine
  Visual studio is not installed

Steps to Reproduce:

Getting the below error when building a console application using **dotnet run** command in command line
Unexpected error writing debug information -- 'Unable to cast COM object of type 'System.__ComObject' to interface type 'Microsoft.Cci.ISymUnmanagedWriter5'. This operation failed because the QueryInterface call on the COM component for the interface with IID '{DCF7780D-BDE9-45DF-ACFE-21731A32000C}' failed due to the following error: No such interface supported (Exception from HRESULT: 0x80004002 (E_NOINTERFACE)).'

data.title: Phantom build error when dbset name changed
Typescript hinting breaks on "Find all references"
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows 10 x64
1. Having a sizeable Typescript project (at least 50 .ts files)
2. Pick "Find all references", a "No results found" window appear
3. Hinting (Ctrl+Space, Ctrl+Shift+Space, hovering over methods and variables) stops working everywhere
4. The only way to restore functionality is restarting vscode

data.title: When renaming a file, rename it using git if in a repository

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: OS X El Capitan

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Rename a file via the sidebar

Expected result:
- Git registers the rename (ie. when using `git mv`)

Actual result:
- Git doesn't recognize the operation as a rename, but rather thinks the file with the old name was deleted, and the renamed file appears untracked.

Find telemetry for this

File Name:
localize\ENU\Microsoft.VisualStudio.ApplicationInsights.dll

Resource ID:
0; "RelatedItemsInlineText"

query:
Please clarify what this string will be followed by. Thanks.    Zinacle 4/27/2016 2:56:27 PM

data.title: [oc][Query][DevDiv] Please clarify "Debug"
data.body:
Hi, we have a question from our translator and I was hoping you could help.

Source:
Debug Call Stack
Debug Watch Expressions

File Name:
src\vs\workbench\parts\debug\browser\debugViews.nls.resx

Resource ID:
".resx", 0; "callStackAriaLabel"
".resx", 0; "watchAriaTreeLabel"

Query:
Please clarify if "Debug" is noun here, or a verb. Thanks.      Zinacle 4/27/2016 12:17:02 PM

data.body:

Source:
Customizes which terminal to on Linux.

File Name:
src\vs\workbench\parts\execution\electron-browser\terminal.contribution.nls.resx

Resource ID:
".resx", 0; "terminal.external.linuxExec"

Query:
It looks like the verb "run" is missing from the source. Please check and confirm.

Contributes textmate color themes.

".resx", 0; "vscode.extension.contributes.themes"

Could you give more information here? It's hard to get the exact meaning of "Contribute". Thanks." by="CnE_zh-CN_translator_29

data.title: [loc][Query][DevDiv] Please clarify "code"
data.body:
Hi, we have a question about the English source. Please see below.

Source:
Click go to code
It is recommended not to run Code as 'root'.
Navigate to the code for the topmost method from the stack trace in my code.

File Name (respectively):
localize\ENU\Microsoft.VisualStudio.ApplicationInsights.dll
src\vs\workbench\electron-browser\shell.nls.resx
localize\ENU\Microsoft.VisualStudio.ApplicationInsights.dll

Resource ID (respectively):
0; "ClickGoToCode"
".resx", 0; "runningAsRoot"
0; "CodeLensGotoMyCodeHyperlinkTooltip"

Query:
Does code mean a concrete conception (which should be localized as 代码), or a code editor (which should be left as it is)? Please confirm. Thanks.   " by="CnE_zh-CN_translator

data.title: After set "window.zoomLevel": -1 or -2. the character on editor is blurred.
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.0.0
- OS Version:Win 10 Pro

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Add setting to user setting.json "window.zoomLevel": -1,
2. Go to editor and all code is blurred. When scroll sometime it clear back then go blur again. Ref this:
   ![bug blurred](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19192116/15036130/0d8c3ec8-12b5-11e6-9025-e0d88193906f.gif)

data.title: autofetch causes ssh-askpass to popup
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0
- OS Version: Ubuntu

Steps to Reproduce:
1. install any of the `ssh-askpass` packages
2. have a git repo with passphrased ssh key
3. open VSCode
4. observe that ssh-askpass would popup

This is probably expected given the autofetch setting is the default. I am not sure how to solve it. 

Maybe auto-disable autofetch when one of the following is true
- askpass is installed
- git repo is detected to have a password

data.title: OSX <fstream> cannot be found in default CPP Include Path /usr/include
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.4

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Setup a C++ project in VS Code
2. `include <fstream>` in source

I see a green wavy line under `include <fstream>` with a lightbulb. When I click the lightbulb the c_cpp_properties.json file is opened.  I see that /usr/include is listed as the include path.  I can see that <fstream> is in this path (actually it's in /usr/include/c++/4.2.1/ ... but other C++ headers in the same folder seem to work ok... like <sstream> and <map>)

What am I doing wrong?

data.title: The files.insertFinalNewline setting doesn't work in the 1.1.0-insiders build
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0-insiders
- OS Version: Windows 8

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Add the user setting: "files.insertFinalNewline": true,
2. Edit a file and save

I expect that a newline is added at the end of the file. It is in the 1.0 release, but it is not in the 1.1.0-insiders build.

data.title: Run Build Task not running on Linux
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0-alpha
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Run Build Task (Ctrl+Shift+B or run from F1 menu)

The tasks window opens but the errors are not showing up.
